results.title: Simple organisms: Bacteria (Revised)
results.brief_description: Looks at the discovery of bacteria and examines their structure and means of feeding. Binary fission and antibiotics are examined, as are some uses of bacteria, nitrogen fixing, cheese making and chemical manufacture.

results.title: Australia's first foreign war: the Waikato
results.creator_credit: John Laynton, Edwin Morrisby and Southern Latitude Films
results.brief_description: This documentary suggests that the Maori Wars of 1863-64, rather than the Sudan War of 1899-1901, were Australia’s first experience of war, by noting New Zealand’s governor, Sir George Grey’s activities in advertising for, and recruiting volunteers from the Australian colonies. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Si Mamad (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Handojo Misc, Sjumandjaja, Lambang Film Teledan and Matari Film
results.brief_description: A poor, middle-aged Muslim archivist steals stationery from his office to support his family, only to find that the store to which he sells the stationery to is owned by his boss. He develops an obsessional guilt complex and compulsion to confess his dishonesty. A tragi-comedy, providing some incisive observations of the contemporary scene in Jakarta, in particular the gap between the rich and the poor. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Who cares?
results.brief_description: A dramatised recreation concerning the plight of a homeless teenage boy who has turned to prostitution in order to survive. Set in Sydney’s King Cross area the story tells of the efforts of some high school children to help him and attempts to explain the pressures that can cause a child to get into this situation. Financed by various companies and organisations in Sydney.

results.title: Run for your life
results.brief_description: Examines the reasons why runners of all ages have opted for this form of exercise. Interviews with joggers and physicians point out the psychological and medical benefits of running and stress the importance of cardiovascular health in today’s urban, sedentary lifestyle. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Chris Cree Brown: electronic composer
results.creator_credit: Chris Dillon, Hugh McDonald and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows electronic composer Chris Cree Brown recording taped music, discovering sounds in the environment and stressing that one should listen to new sounds in a receptive way. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Werner Herzog eats his shoe
results.brief_description:
In 1979 German film director Werner Herzog publicly ate his desert boots to honour a wager that he had made to Errol Morris, after Morris succeeded in completing one of the films he always talked about. Includes footage from ‘Even Dwarfs Started Small’ and ‘The Gold Rush’.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sky rider
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: An animated satire on space travel, with a central character representing “the man in the street” who takes his rocket to a galaxy and to satellites, well ahead of the Russian and American astronauts. The various forms of simple animation used in this film would provide an excellent motivation for students of animation techniques. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Phoenix Films
